item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "What have you been reading, The Gospel according to St. Bastard?!" -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "This is not a game of Who The Fuck Are You." -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by A.A. Milne
Bibliovixen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Ducking for apples -- change one letter and it's the story of my life." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Brevity is the soul of lingerie." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "It serves me right for putting all my eggs in one bastard." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Don't look at me in that tone of voice." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Women and elephants never forget." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "She runs the gamut of emotions from A to B." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Bibliovixen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "For the moment I can only cry out that I have lost my splendid mirage. Come back, come back, O glittering and white!" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
